definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Keyes, however, was on foot at the back of the parade.
sentences.chinese: 然而，凱斯走在遊行隊伍的最後面。

sentences.english: Khomeini’s regime responded with remarkable brutality, slaughtering thousands of the organization’s members.
sentences.chinese: 霍梅尼政權殘忍的鎮壓遊行，屠殺了幾千名組織成員。

sentences.english: The people working here tonight have no beef with the picket line .
sentences.chinese: 今晚在這裏上工的人與遊行罷工的人並無芥蒂。

sentences.english: An initial police estimate put the number of participants at 8,000.
sentences.chinese: 警方初步估計參與遊行的人數達到了8000。

sentences.english: Their first exhibition of themselves was in a processional march of two and two round the parish.
sentences.chinese: 他們最初的表演是排成雙行隊伍繞着教區遊行。

sentences.english: In Topeka , Kansas, it is illegal to drive ones car through a parade.
sentences.chinese: 在堪薩斯州的託皮卡，開車穿過遊行隊伍也是違法的。

sentences.english: Organizers called on supporters to march from there to Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 組織者呼籲支持者從祖科蒂公園遊行至華爾街。

sentences.english: Another marcher switched targets when it was his turn at the bullhorn.
sentences.chinese: 輪到另一名遊行者使用擴音器時，他轉換了目標。

sentences.english: Most cities are the home to a myriad of parades and festivals.
sentences.chinese: 大多數城市都有很多遊行和節日活動。

sentences.english: Large anti-Japanese protests erupted during the latest party meeting.
sentences.chinese: 大規模的抗日遊行在此次五中全會期間爆發。

sentences.english: In China during anti-Japan riots, yes.
sentences.chinese: 中國的反日遊行，算是吧。

sentences.english: A：I took my little sister to see the Thanksgiving Day parade before dinner.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯前我帶我的小妹去看了感恩節遊行。

sentences.english: The only president not to parade down Pennsylvania Avenue was Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的總統不跌賓夕法尼亞大道的遊行是羅納德里根。

sentences.english: The students were parading for peace.
sentences.chinese: 學生們示威遊行，要求和平。

sentences.english: Originally there was another parade of nations during the closing ceremonies of the Games.
sentences.chinese: 起初，在奧運會閉幕式上還有一次運動員遊行。

sentences.english: In Cairo, thousands of demonstrators have ignored a curfew.
sentences.chinese: 在開羅，上千個遊行者無視宵禁的存在。

definition: meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
Chinatown/also called 唐人街[Tang2 ren2 jie1]
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to be present/to be on the scene
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
